page.title: 02LAUND HOUSE FARM
page.content: All fields in the area are surrounded by well established hedges, and in some places quite mature deciduous trees are growing. About 70% of the area is cultivated. Crops grown this year include barley and wheat. A few fields have already been ploughed in preparation for the sowing of winter corn. 30% of the area is pasture land for grazing cattle. A small stream runs east-west across the area. There is one farm in the area. It is called Laund House Farm. Although the farmhouse itself is empty, the farm foreman lives in a caravan on the site. He told us that he had worked 35 years for the same employer, as stockman. The farmhouse was condemned ten years ago, and is due to bedemolished very soon. There are plans for a new house to be constructed on the same site.
